fields.summary: JSD Portal login / signup screen intermittently showing endless spinner
My requests page (re-)loading is sometimes showing endless spinner

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The JSD / SP integration triggers 401 errors when loading JSD portal pages (and possibly any other Connect add-on integration in the portal)
h3. Environment
 - Service Desk
 - Status Page connect integration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the JSD/SP integration and navigate to the portal
 # Navigate to the portal 

h3. Expected Results

An iframe should load with the JSD/SP integration.
h3. Actual Results

A 401 error happens in the console, preventing the connect add-on integration iframe to load.

h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: JSD Portal / Status Page integration broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "My Requests" page is not reloading after filtering on the new portal view.

h3. Environment

New portal view.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Enable the new portal view;
# Go to My requests;
# Choose one of the filters;
# The page will not reload.

h3. Expected results

The page should reload after one of the filters is chosen.
 [^Oldportal.mp4] 

h3. Actual result

The page is not reloading after one of the filters is chosen.
 [^newportal.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

Disable the new portal view.
fields.summary: My requests page filtering options aren't working

fields.description:
Hi, I would like to know if it is possible

to reuse the token of our Website ( https://sobloo.eu ),  to be reused when our customers click on support ( [https://sobloo.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/user/login?destination=portals] ) to connect them in an SSO manners  ?

Can you clarify me with detail about this implementation ?

Best regards

remy.salle
fields.summary: SSO service

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The approvals buttons (approve / decline) are not working on Service Desk projects

h3. Environment
 - Service Desk
 - a workflow that requires approvals

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# customer open a request that requires approval and tries to approve

h3. Expected Results

The request is approved

h3. Actual Results

No action happens and no error found in the browser console
fields.summary: Approvals buttons not working on Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Summary  
Customer portal 'My Requests' filters not working without page refresh

h3. Environment
Latest FF & Chrome on Windows and Mac
Internet Explorer is not affected

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Login to the customer portal
# View My Requests
# Use one of the filters
# Notice the URL changes but issues list does not update and the filters grey out
# You must refresh the page for the issue list to update

h3. Expected Results
* The issue list updates once you choose a filter

h3. Actual Results
* The issue list does not update until the page is refreshed

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
* Refresh the page
fields.summary: Customer portal 'My Requests' filters not working without page refresh

fields.description:
Enable activity view to let agents view the issues reported by a particular reporter.

Previously, hovering over a reporter (customer) name in issue view, a menu pops-up where clicking on *Activity* menu loads the page with the issues reported by the same customer. Now, a *Peoples & Teams* page appears.

To workaround this, you need to go to customers in the project, search for a particular customer and then look for issues reported by that customer.
fields.summary: Enable activity view to view the issues reported by a particular reporter.

fields.description:
!image-2018-11-26-11-31-06-770.png|width=208,height=150!

There's currently no way to access "My Requests" pages in the customer portal via clicking in the UI.

 

*Workaround*

Access the url /servicedesk/customer/user/requests?status=open to land on the page and see your requests.

 

*Update as of 11:30am Sydney time*

We are working on a fix, ETA 1h30 for it to be out. E.g. 1pm Sydney time.
fields.summary: My Requests page links not available from the JSD Portal

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It is currently not possible to clone issues from the Customer Portal (only from the internal JIRA UI).

When customers need submit similar requests often via the Customer Portal, it can be pretty time consuming to fill in all the fields everything time they raise a request.

It would be helpful to have a "clone" button on the customer portal to allow customers to clone a previously submitted ticket to save them time.


h3. Suggested Solution

From the "My Requests" page on the Customer Portal, add a "Clone" button next to each request, as shown in the screenshot below:
 !Example.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround 

No workaround.
fields.summary: Add the possibility to clone a past request from the customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The ctrl+v keyboard shortcut doesn't allow customers to paste images from the clipboard(copy/paste) in the customer portal using IE11. This issue only seems to occur on the new help center. Additionally, it's not possible to paste by right-clicking and choosing "Paste".
h3. Environment

JSD Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log into the portal where the new help center is enabled
 # Start filling out a request form
 # Copy an image to the OS clipboard
 # Paste the image into the form using ctrl+v

h3. Expected Results
 * The image/item is added to the comment as an attachment
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-23 at 13.44.43.png|thumbnail!
(taken to using old help center)

h3. Actual Results
 * Nothing happens/changes

h3. Notes
 * The keyboard shortcut works on other browsers such as Chrome and Firefox
 * Similar/related issues:
JRACLOUD-65670
JRACLOUD-62233
JSDCLOUD-6351

h3. Workaround
 * Use another browser
 * Turn off the new help center: Navigate to Project Settings > Portal Settings > View and customize; under Try the new help center, put the toggle switch into the "off" position.  Please quote this bug ticket number in the feedback form.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-11 at 11.37.11 PM (1).png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: New help center: Unable to paste(ctrl+v) images from clipboard on the request form using IE11

fields.description:
It will be good if we can configure in one project Service Desk - Email address per request_type.
ie. atm@domen for request_type ATM
pos@domen for request_type POS
cards@domen for request_type CARDS

We are payment processor with many clients. Already have mail groups like atm@domen; pos@domen; cards@domen; ... And for every process we have group of agents.
An alternative is to create independent service desk projects for every request_type, which is even more meaningless.

Of course there are more workaround possible. But for improving the quality of the product, it is important to best suit the requirements of customers.
It only opens the possibility that if someone has a need to configure Email address per request_type, there is this possibility in the JIRA Service Desk product.
fields.summary: Service Desk - Email address per request_type

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently, when an issue have "Request Type" value previously, customer will still be able to view the ticket in Customer Portal , add comment and add attachment. However, this will only happen for new issue. For existing ticket, customer still can view the ticket from Customer Portal , but unable to add comment. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create issue via email or create issue on behalf of customer (Make sure the "Request Type" value exist upon issue creation)
# Then, move the ticket to a different issue type , to change the "Request Type" value to "No Match".
# Then, by using the customer account, view the issue from Customer Portal and add a comment. The customer should be able to add comment.
# Now, search for any existing issue that contains "Request Type" value. 
# Then, move the ticket to a different issue type , to change the "Request Type" value to "No Match".
# Then, by using the customer account, view the issue from Customer Portal and add a comment. The customer hit into error when adding comment.

h3. Expected Results
Able to add comment.

h3. Actual Results
Error pop up
{noformat}
"The type of request, that you're trying to view does not exist.
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Every instance may differ on the benchmark date to consider as existing issue.

h3.Workaround
Reinsert back the "Request Type" value.
fields.summary: Inconsistent behaviour when "Request Type" value is empty

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Give Feedback popup is not populating the "I'm giving feedback mainly around" field drop-down while giving a feedback through the portal.

h3. Environment

View and customize the help center.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Go to the project settings;
# Visit the portal settings;
# Click on View and customize;
# Click on Give Feedback;
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-02 at 15.51.51.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected results

The drop-down should be populated with some values.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-02 at 14.25.35.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

The drop-down is not populated and the feedback cannot be submitted.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-02 at 14.25.55.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Give the feedback though Jira and not portal.
# Click on the profile picture;
# Then Give Feedback.
fields.summary: Give Feedback button is not populating the drop-down in the customer portal again

fields.description:
As an agent if you are trying to update the customer or ask them for info and they have disabled notifications (Don't notify me button in portal) it results in a silent request. If the agent is aware that the customer is not getting notified they can reach out through other channels if needed.
 * *Ideal solution* = a field or other visual representation that customer (requestor) has silenced notifications for the specific issue.
 * *Acceptable solution* = an event is created when the requestor disables notifications

*NOTE*: this doesn't have to be done for Participants just the Requestor
fields.summary: Notify agent if customer disables notifications on an issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Knowledge base articles are restricted to 600px wide when viewed within a JSD project.

With the width of today's monitors, it does not seem to make much sense restricting the width of content that narrow. There is a tonne of empty space either side of the article.

h3. Suggested Solution
Increase width of the article wrapper or make it full width responsive.

h3. Workaround
View in Confluence
fields.summary: Increase width of KB articles displayed within Jira

fields.description: Please provide SD portal Lithuanian language support.
fields.summary: Lithuanian langage support for SD Cloud

fields.description:
We constantly have users who find their way to the main Jira login page for our company. They complain to us, "I can't login to view my support tickets!" because Jira just gives a message saying they don't have access.

Instead Jira should see that this user only has Service Desk Customer login access and either automatically log them in there, or at least direct them there to login.
fields.summary: Redirect user login to Customer Login page if us is portal only user who tries to login to the Jira admin page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When we're configuring the customers notifications, there's no option to customize it according to request types. For instance, I'd like the notification regarding issue created to be sent for the request types X and Y, but not for Z.


h3. Suggest Solution
Add the ability to do so.


h3. Workaround
Use the automation rules from Service Desk for certain events such as:

When: Issue Created
If: Issue matches -> {{"Customer Request Type" = X}}
Then: Send email
fields.summary: Customize notifications per Request Type

fields.description:
I would like to request either a differentiation between the *Share with Customer* Button vs. *Comment Internally* in ServiceDesk. Another option would be to add a second prompt before sending the email to the customer directly that would read "Confirm sending reply to customer."

 

This would help as the buttons are quite similar visually yet produce entirely different outcomes and avoid confusion for our support staff.
fields.summary: Differentiate between Share with Customer button vs. Comment Internally

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Widget request creation fails if the request type is associated to an issue type with required-but-unsupported field (eg: project picker). Note that JSD agents would see a "configuration problem" when viewing the queue.
h2. Step to reproduce
 # Have an issue type with required-but-unsupported field in JSD (eg: project picker)
 # Configure a request type to the issue type in step 1
 # Configure a Widget to the request type in step 2
 # Raise a request via the Widget

h2. Expected

Request creation fails with an error
h2. Actual

Confirmation message is presented in the UI, but request is not created
h2. Workaround

Set the unsupported field to optional or remove it from the issue type
fields.summary: Widget request creation fails if an unsupported field is set to required

fields.description:
Currently, Jira does not respect the language a customer interacts in.

h3. Scenario 1
User is not logged in (using browser language detection as Japanese)
User sees the respective form in Japanese, fills this out the form and their email.
Emails are received in English and the Request Language setting is set to "Language Unknown".
Changes to the Request Language by the service desk agent has no effect on the emails being sent.

*Expected* In this case changing the Request Language should change the language emails are being sent in. The Request Language should also have been set to whatever language was detected from the Browser at the time of creation.

h3. Scenario 2
User is logged in (using browser language detection as Japanese)
User sees the respective form in Japanese, fills this out the form and their email.
Emails are received in English and the Request Language setting is set to "Language Unknown".
Changes to the Request Language by the service desk agent has no effect on the emails being sent.
If the User changes their language in the Profile to Japanese will correctly send emails in Japanese.

*Expected* At time of creation the Request Language should be set to the current Browser Language. All emails to the User should respect this value, even if changed by a service desk agent, unless the user changes the language value in his/her profile.

h3. Scenario 3
User is logged in and has set language to Japanese.
User sees the respective form in Japanese, fills this out the form and their email.
Emails are received in Japanese and the Request Language setting is set to "Language Unknown".
Changes to the Request Language by the service desk agent has no effect on the emails being sent. (As expected)
If the User changes their language in the Profile to Japanese/English will correctly send emails in Japanese.

*Expected* At time of creation the Request Language should be set to the users selected language. If the user reverts their language back to "Browser Detected" then emails should be sent using the "Request Language" value.
fields.summary: Jira email notification in user language.

fields.description:
Hi Jira Sales Team,

Greetings!

May we request to have a quotation for your Jira Service Desk Solution. See our details below.

 

Company: 2GO Group Inc.

Location: Pasay City, Philippines

Estimated number of users: 4,000

Estimated number of Technician: 100

 

If you have any queries, feel free to let me know.

 

Thank you

 

Jorge
fields.summary: Request for Quotation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customer activity does not display in the notification panel even though the badge shows a notification (it does show if updated by Jira users)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Comment on a ticket as a customer from the portal or email
 # As an agent refresh your page and you will see a badge on the notifcation panel indicating 1 notificaiton
 # There is no notification listed but the agent does receive an email Jira notification

h3. Expected Results

A notification informing agent customer has commented, as suggeted by the badge icon
 - Any action that results in an emailed Jira notification should be displayed here

h3. Actual Results

No notification is displayed
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

No known workaround
fields.summary: JSD Customer activity does not display in the notification panel even though the badge shows a notification

fields.description:
When a Issue is lined to a Story or another issue, in the "jira.view.issue.links.sort.order" following things can be helpful to use it more effectively:
 # Headers missing
 # Resolution is missing
 # For Priorities only icon is getting displayed whereas we require Priority Name

Kindly look into the matter so that we can use it more effectively and also we are facing usability problems without this things.

Please do the needful at earliest...
fields.summary: Require small changes in "jira.view.issue.links.sort.order"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When customers complete their sign up process, if the link they follow has an expired token they'll see a blank screen instead of an error screen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable the new help center
 # Invite a user to the portal.
 # Proceed to complete the sign up by following the link in the email.
 # Modify the token parameter in the url (e.g. delete a character) and submit.

h3. Expected Results

The sign up page shows an error screen explaining that the token has expired or is invalid and a new sign up email will need to be sent.
h3. Actual Results

The sign up page shows a blank screen.
h3. Notes

This currently only happens when the new help center is turned on.

see [https://tyche-techsupport.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/10/user/visitportal?username=qm:98878471-4d19-42b9-8b21-53181a9eb59e:5bdf3d6fa752ae425d2a3ece&appUserId=10040&token=0e66d6434c072d891da8610cd02153c406509d7d] for an example.
h3. Workaround

The fix for an individual customer is to resend the signup email.

To avoid the blank screen showing up on an instance, disable the the new help center.
fields.summary: Portal sign up form shows a blank screen if token has expired

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Unable to import Request Participants field using CSV import feature. For both user-facing CSV import and admin-facing CSV import features.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow Request Participants to be included in CSV import

h3. Why this is important
* To correctly export/import via CSV (currently CSV export includes Request participant)
* To automate the assignment of Request Participant via CSV create issue or update issue
 
h3. Workaround 
Using REST API to add Request participant
* https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/rest/api-group-request/#api-rest-servicedeskapi-request-issueidorkey-participant-post
fields.summary: Allow CSV Import for Request Participants field

fields.description:
We work in a Japanese office and our Service Desk agents have two ways of writing their name. One is with Kanji, which Japanese customers would understand but non-japanese would not. The other is with English characters.

It would be great if we could define how a service agent's name is displayed to the customer depending on the language of the Request.
fields.summary: Agent Name Translations

fields.description: Hi, my customer wants to add organization at ticket creation in automation rules, and set mail domain in this rules
fields.summary: Add organization and domain in automation rules

fields.description:
Hi, my customer wants to edit the mail template for agents, in order to delete the "add comment" section, and the mail footer

!https://2013.ex10.biz/owa/attachment.ashx?id=RgAAAAAJA59w1gBuTJIgYqhJSx8HBwBcl174fEePRaLC0M1G2Q2eAAAACKJaAABcl174fEePRaLC0M1G2Q2eAAArsQIPAAAJ&attcnt=1&attid0=BAABAAAA&attcid0=image001.png%4001D46D3E.FFE8BDF0|width=636,height=183!
fields.summary: Edit email template for agents

fields.description:
Hi, my customer wants to change the name of the mail [sender  noreply@mail.notifications.atlassian.com|mailto:sender%C2%A0%C2%A0noreply@mail.notifications.atlassian.com] for his clients.

We need to edit it

  !https://2013.ex10.biz/owa/attachment.ashx?id=RgAAAAAJA59w1gBuTJIgYqhJSx8HBwBcl174fEePRaLC0M1G2Q2eAAAACKJaAABcl174fEePRaLC0M1G2Q2eAAArsQIPAAAJ&attcnt=1&attid0=BAAAAAAA&attcid0=image004.png%4001D46D28.9E9A9FC0|width=372,height=106!
fields.summary: Edit sender name noreply@mail.notifications.atlassian.com

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently in Automation feature, when choosing the trigger other than "Approval required" , for "Send Email" action, it only can send to *Reporter (customer)* and *Customers involved*. Some adminitrator would like to send email specifically to the *Approvers* , but there's no option for that.
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-09 at 7.42.34 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add *Approvers* in *To* selection.

h3. Why this is important
 Administrator only wants to send email to the *Approvers* if the issue haven't being approve or decline.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Add "Approvers" as an option for the recipient for "Send Email" action in Automation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Agents are able to access hidden request types

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new request type
# Access via the customer portal this new request and save this link.
# Set this request as hidden(by removing from all the groups).
# Try to access the link saved on step 2.

h3. Expected Results
* You should receive an error saying that this request type it's not available.

h3. Actual Results

If you are logged in with an Agent account you are able to see the form, but if you try to submit you will receive the following error:
!loggedError.png|thumbnail!

In a project that allows users to raise requests *without* logging in, if the user tries to access the link while logged out, the message above is shown right after the user tries to access the link
!loggedOutError.png|thumbnail!


h3. Notes
On IE 11 if you do not enable third-party cookies you will experience the same behavior then the users that are not logged in.
fields.summary: Agents are able to access hidden request types

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When customers need to complete their sign up process, the sign up page shows "Welcome to undefined" instead of the name of the portal. This currently only happens when the new help center is turned on.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable the new help center
# Invite a user to the portal. Proceed to complete the sign up by following the link in the email.

h3. Expected Results
The sign up pages shows Welcome to "portal name"
h3. Actual Results
The sign up pages shows Welcome to undefined
 
h3. Notes
This currently only happens when the new help center is turned on

h3. Workaround
Disable the the new help center
fields.summary: Portal sign up shows "Welcome to undefined" in the new help center

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Issue creation in a JSD project shows a duplicated information on the Activity stream.

h2. Steps to Reproduce
* Browse to the project settings > *Language Support*
** Then add a secondary language support
* Create a JIRA Service Desk ticket
* Access a dashboard which has the Activity Stream gadget
 
 _Expected Results_
Agents receive a notification regarding the issue creation.
 
 _Actual Results_
Agents receive a notification regarding the issue creation and a second one about the Request Language field value being updated as we can see below:
!activity.png|thumbnail!

*Notes:*
The issue only starts to occur after you add a second language to the customer portal. Even if you remove the language you will keep receiving the notifications as well.
fields.summary: Duplicated notifications for issue created on the Activity Stream for JIRA Service Desk Projects

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Workload report will list out the agents of the project. Normally, add-on users will be part of the agents role. Due to that, they are listed in the report.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best to remove add-on users from the report because by right they will not work on any issues.

h3. Why this is important
 Easier for admin to monitor the report. 

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Remove Add-on users from Workload report

fields.description:
*Summary*
Clicking an Anchor leading to another Page on the same Space redirects to the Portal Home


*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create an Anchor com Page A
# On Page B, inside the same Space, link to the Anchor on Page A
# Access Page B via the Service Desk Portal Knowledge base
# Click the Anchor

*Expected Results*
Redirect the user to the Anchor on Page A

*Actual Results*
A new tab/window is opened, and a quick loading animation for Page A is displayed, but then the user is redirected to the portal home
* *Note* this also happens when clicking links to headings on Page A. In this case, the redirect lands on a "Not found" warning after quickly showing Page A

*Workaround*
No Workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Clicking an Anchor leading to another Page on the same Space redirects to the Portal Home

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer is following the permission in "Customer Permission" in order to add the "Request Participant". However, as agent. they are allowed to share it to anyone. This could be a problem incase they shared to a wrong email or customer.

h3. Suggested Solution
Agent need to follow the "Customer Permission" behavior.

h3. Why this is important
It could be a risk for security if the agent shared to a wrong email or customer.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Prevent Service Desk agent to add anyone in "Request Participant"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when users submit an email request for Service Desk there is no feature that allows admins to restrict the email request for specific email domains.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow restriction to particular domains for valid e-mails request to avoid spam account creation.
fields.summary: Include Domain Level Restrictions For Email Request

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
When adding a column with the cascading custom field to a queue, it cannot be sorted on the fly as other field types.

h3. Suggested resolution
Ability to sort on the fly for cascading fields.
fields.summary: Cascading custom field is not sortable on queues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an agent is a request participant or a member of the same organization as a customer, this agent will be treated as a customer even if they are the assignee of the ticket, and:
 - the SLA won't stop ticking on the condition "Comment: For Customers"
 - the Automation rule that transitions the status from "Waiting for support" to "Waiting for Customer" won't be trigger either

h3. Steps to reproduce
 - Create a Service Desk project
 - Create an agent account (with a JSM license) and a customer account in this project
 - Create an organization and add *the agent and the customer* to this organization / Add the agent to the request participants field
 - Make sure that the "Time to first response" SLA is configured to stop on the condition "Comment: For Customers"
 - Log into JIRA as the agent, and add a public comment to the ticket

h3. Observed Results

Since the agent is treated as a customer:
 - The Time to First Response SLA does not stop
 - The issue does not transition from the "Waiting for support" to the "Waiting for Customer" status

h3. Expected Results

The agent should not be treated as a customer, and the following behavior should be observed:
 - The Time to First Response SLA stops
 - The issue transitions from the "Waiting for support" to the "Waiting for Customer" status

h3. Workarounds
 - Remove the agent from the Request participants field or the organization
fields.summary: The condition "Comment: For Customers" won't trigger the SLA to stop if the agent is a request participant or member of the same organization as the customer

fields.description:
Dear Service Desk, 

We need the option to add quick links on the customer portal to lead our customers directly to our knowledge base (confluence).

It appears that the only option for this is to buy a third party plugin or use fields (like notification fields) that are not primarily meant for this. However, we think that this a basic functionality that is missing now. We need this function to link our customers to our knowledge base (Jira confuence) and therewith use the Service Desk as central point for you customers. 

Thank you in advance for considering to implement this change and for your feedback.

Kind regards, 

 

Gert-Jan
fields.summary: Quick link between customer portal and confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers who are migrating to Service Desk from another email support-like system would like their Customers who Email Service Desk for the first time to receive an Invitation or Welcome like message 

Currently, when a Customer self signs-up by sending an Email to the Service Desk Email Channel, by default they only receive an Request Created notification.  Anyone CCd on the Email or were Invited by an Agent in the Service Desk Project receive the Invitation email. 

h3. Suggested Solution
When any account is created in Service Desk, send an Invitation or Welcome message

h3. Why this is important
In this use case, the Same Custom Email Address/Mailbox would used between the Old Support System and Service Desk; when that cutover occurs, a notification should be sent out to the Customer letting them know that Service Desk is being used now. 
 
h3. Workaround 
Have the Agents invite the Customers into the Service Desk Project; this will send the Invitation to the Customer
fields.summary: Send Welcome Message When a Customer Self Signs-up via Email

fields.description: When creating an issue, I would like it to be able to set the due date as endOfDay(-1) or now(). Currently I can only set it as a static date.
fields.summary: Service Desk Automation or Request Type Variables

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* When a JSD customer is typing a comment in the portal, and accidentally moves away from the page(refresh, close browser) - the comment is lost

h3. Suggested Solution
* In Jira, the browser prompts the user that they will lose unsaved changes.  JSD portals should behave in the same way:
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-30 at 11.12.57 AM.png|thumbnail! 
* Better yet, a feature could be added to Jira/JSD to provide the ability for users/customers to recover lost work

h3. Why this is important
* Can cause friction if the page is automatically/accidentally refreshed and work is lost
 
h3. Workaround 
* Try a browse extension similar to this one [Typio Form Recovery|https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/typio-form-recovery/djkbihbnjhkjahbhjaadbepppbpoedaa?hl=en]
fields.summary: Portal: When typing comment and the page is refreshed/user navigates away, the comment is lost

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It is not possible to create an IT Service Desk project if the default language is set to Slovak

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the default language (in Jira general configurations) to Slovak
# Create a Service Desk project

h3. Expected Results
Service Desk project created
h3. Actual Results
Service Desk project not created created with error *Project not created* For some reason the magic didn't happen. Click Create to try again.

h3.Workaround
Change the default language to English, create the project, then change the language back
fields.summary: Unable to create Service Desk project in default Slovak Language

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When user had an account but never logged to a Portal and then was deactivated and now trying to Sing Up via Portal, JSD send a validation email with the newly generated token inside which is invalid.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a customer account
# Deactivate it
# As a user go to a Portal and try to sing up

h3. Expected Results
Generic confirmation message is shown to the user. No email is sent 

h3. Actual Results
Validation emails is sent to a user. When he click on it he got a message "Link is bad"

h3. Nice to have
Somehow inform admin/agent about such user's attempt. May be in audit logs
fields.summary: JSD sends validation email to an inactive customer

fields.description: Currently it is not intuitive for an end user to click on the account icon in the upper right hand corner and know that is where they will find the requests they have submitted. My suggestion is to make is obvious where to go for my requests by including a link that says "My Requests" on the front page.
fields.summary: Create link on Customer Portal page for "My Requests"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When performing a Jira site import into a site with Jira Service Desk and JSD customers, the JSD customers are preserved, while the regular users are deleted.

This behaviour is outlined in the [Support Readiness|https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/x/TkA4D], [public documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2018/05/jira-import-syncs-customer-account-directory], and a warning was added to this [page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-issues-776636788.html].

*This is a problem when customer have the option 'Anyone with an account on ...' selected in customer permissions under 'Who can access the portal and send requests to '. An SD customer before import will have access to the project after import, even if it was not imported* 

h3. Suggested Solution

Delete customer users when importing.
 
h3. Workaround 

Find the user(s) in 'Portal only customers' in User Management and deactivate it (them).
fields.summary: Jira import should delete JSD customers not included in the import file
Test

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement
If links of other Confluence pages (within the same space) are added to a knowledge base article (related articles, etc), when customers access these links from the portal view it will direct them to the Confluence view of the page. Customers may not have Atlassian Account to access the page from Confluence. 

h3. Suggestion 
Detect if other confluence pages linked in a knowledge base article are accessed from the portal or widget, and it shloud have an auto direction to the portal view of the page instead of the Confluence view
fields.summary: Confluence pages linked in a knowledge base article should direct Portal only users to portal view of the knowledge base instead of the Confluence view

fields.description:
Dear,

It is possible that the Delivery Date system field may show time
fields.summary: System fields delivery date does not show delivery time

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When change profile language to *France* , there's variable link is not displaying correctly. As per example in "Customer Permission" Page. In English , it display as :-
{panel}
To allow only people with accounts on https://nroslan.atlassian.net to send requests, change the Global settings.
{panel}

But, in France it display as :-

{noformat}
Pour restreindre lenvoi de requêtes aux personnes ayant un compte sur {0}, {1}modifiez les paramètres globaux{2}
{noformat}

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open JIRA Service Desk project "Customer Permission" page.
# Then, in new tab , open Profile to change the language to "France"
# Refresh the "Customer Permission" page:-
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-26 at 5.33.42 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Additional info :-

In English :-
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-26 at 5.35.04 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
*Pour autoriser uniquement les personnes ayant des comptes sur https://nroslan.atlassian.net à envoyer des demandes, modifiez les paramètres globaux.*

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}Pour restreindre lenvoi de requêtes aux personnes ayant un compte sur {0}, {1}modifiez les paramètres globaux{2}{noformat}

h3.Workaround
No workaround.
fields.summary: Some variable in France is not displaying correctly

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Clicking on the Create button in the customer portal to create a ticket while uploading an attachment without waiting for the attachment to be fully uploaded would cause the attachment to not be accessible in the portal.
h3. Suggested Solution
Display a warning to warn reporters that an attachment uploading is in progress and would not allow creation to be executed until uploading completes.
h3. Why this is important
 To avoid attachments not accessible by reporters
h3. Workaround
Wait for the attachments to be uploaded completely before clicking on the Create button
fields.summary: Display a warning when users create request while attachments are uploaded.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If a Jira Ops project is created before a Service Desk one, Jira will associate all SD project issue types with the default Jira workflow, instead of creating the service desk template's workflows.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Signup for Jira Ops and Jira Service Desk;
# Create the Jira Ops project first and then create the Jira Service Desk one;
# All Service Desk issue types will be associated with the default Jira workflow, instead of the template's workflows.

h3. Expected results

The issue types will be associated with the correct workflow templates.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-25 at 16.27.15.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual result

All issue types will be associated with the default Jira Workflow.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-25 at 16.27.10.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Delete all the Jira Ops projects and then create the Service Desk one.
fields.summary: Creating a Jira Ops project before Service Desk will not create the template's workflow

fields.description:
Hello 

Cpould you please add this info https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2018/07/customize-your-invitation-emails-to-customers 

to this documentation 

https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-service-desk-notifications-732528936.html - or somewhere else. 

Since it's a new difference between Server and cloud it needs to be clear that you can now customize the "create account" email
fields.summary: Add this new feature to the doc

fields.description:
our client told us that we did not respond to his requests when we looked for his email we found that tickets are assigned to a former employee who is no longer active.
could you help me?
fields.summary: ticket problem

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

* Currently when a Jira Service Desk(JSD) customer signs up for a customer account, the invitation email is translated(if configured to) into the desired language, but the page where the customer sets their password for the first time is in English

h3. Suggested Solution

* Support translations for the customer account sign up flow

h3. Why this is important
* Translations should complete across the whole user experience
* JSD customer experience is disjointed
* Could cause friction as customers may be unsure what is happening/what is required of them

In this example, the default project language is set to Dutch
||Invitation email ||Invitation page (${invitation.url}) ||
|  !Image 2018-10-25 at 12.21.08.jpeg|thumbnail!  |   !Image 2018-10-25 at 12.18.10.jpeg|thumbnail!   |
 
h3. Workaround 
* In the invitation email template: {{Project Settings > Customer notifications; Customer invited}}, add instructions on what will happen next when the customer clicks the link contained in the invitation email
* Use the browser translation tools e.g. Chrome's "Translate this page"
fields.summary: Customer account(portal only) sign up flow: support translations

fields.description: If I go to the portal and submit a ticket and type in an email address, I get a prompt that asks if I want to add the new email address as a  customer. However, if I raise a ticket within the help desk, say from a phone call, and try to type in the caller as a new customer, it prevents me from doing it. I have to back out, add the customer, then go back and change the reporter. Why can't we get a prompt to add the new email as a customer?
fields.summary: Ability to add Customers when setting reporters on internal JIRA Service Desk issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an Agent moves an issue through a transition that has both a "Resolve Issue Screen" (or any other screen with the *Resolution* field visible) and an "Update Issue Field - Resolution", any SLA that depends on the "Resolution Set" event will not be closed.

This is due to the resolution update not being present in the issue history. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the post function *Update Field Value* (Resolution) to the *Resolve issue* transition.
# Add a screen with the *Resolution* field to the same transition.
# Have an SLA that stops on the *Resolution Set* event. (The default "Time to resolution" SLA should do the trick)
# Create and resolve an issue.

h3. Expected Results

The Time to resolution SLA will stop ticking, and the resolution change will be present in the issue history.

h3. Actual Results

The SLA will continue running, and no record of the resolution will be populated in the issue history
 
h3. Notes
In case both the post function and the screen set the same value to the resolution field, nothing will be logged on the issue history. However, if a different value is set, the history will register the change but will still miss the entry from resolution "empty" to the one set by the transition screen.

Please check the screenshot below for a better picture of the issue.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

This bug is similar to two different ones: JSDCLOUD-4038 and JSDCLOUD-6193.

h3.Workaround
Remove either the resolution field or the post function from the transition context.
fields.summary: Setting a resolution twice will not stop resolution dependent SLAs

fields.description: Can customers have an option to provide the satisfaction rating through the portal itself apart from receiving the email notification to provide the satisfaction feedback?
fields.summary: Satisfaction Settings on Portal itself instead of Email

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

When the customer has only access to one portal and the URL https://<instance>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portals is given, the customer will automatically be redirected to the portal.

h3. Suggested resolution

Have the ability to set if the customer will be redirected to the portal or if they will stay in the Help Center page.
fields.summary: Help Center as a landing page, even if the customer has access to only 1 portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attach a screenshot with to-be-submitted comment in Text mode will remove the comment from the Commend field.

h3. Steps to reproduce the problem
# Create an issue from JIRA in a Service Desk project.
# Copy a screenshot to clipboard.
# Open the issue directly eg. https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/<issuekey>
# Type something in the comment in the Text mode, do not submit the comment.
# Paste the image (Ctrl + V).
# Upload the screenshot in the pop-up screen.

h3. Expected result
Screenshot will be uploaded, the comment remains in the Comment box with the wiki markup link of the screenshot at the end of the comment text

h3. Actual result
Screenshot will be uploaded via popup, however, the comment is dismissed

h3. Notes
This does not happen to issues in Business or Software projects.

h3. Workaround
* Open issue via *Detailed view* within the issue navigator:
  !Screenshot 2018-10-24 at 9.38.38 AM.png|thumbnail! 
* OR within any issue viewer, and before adding a comment, *attach the attachment to the issue first*.
fields.summary: Attach screenshot by pasting an image from the clipboard removes the draft comment in Text mode

fields.description:
h3. Summary

A label type custom field does not work for open portals when the customer is not authenticated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a label type custom field
# Add the custom field to the issue type creation screen
# Add the custom field to the request type form
# Open the portal without being logged in (incognito mode) and try to add something in the label field

h3. Expected Results

The user is able to add labels

h3. Actual Results

Old portal: an error saying "Loading failed" is displayed in the field
New portal: a spinning circle runs indefinitely

This error is logged at the console:

{code}
Client must be authenticated to access this resource.
{code}

h3. Workarounds

 - removing the custom field from the request type
 - allow only authenticated access to the portal
fields.summary: Label custom field does not work for open portals

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no option to filter JIRA Service Desk incoming email based on email subject. There's an incident multiple issue created with a same email subject due to the user send multiple times. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best if the email can have a customize filter. For example , if the email subject is same and the previous issue created with the same subject already closed or still open , then a new ticket created.

h3. Why this is important
 Provide flexibility to the administrator to control their incoming email.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to filter incoming email based on email subject

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The mail audit log is located in the application section causing admins having a hard time trying to navigate to it as it is not "intuitive".
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the mail audit logs into the project settings.
h3. Why this is important
To provide a more intuitive navigation experience for admins to find the root cause of a failed email request.
fields.summary: Show the mail audit logs in project settings instead of under applications

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In some cases, JIRA Service Desk administrator does not want the customer to be able to add a participant.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add an option to disable sharing feature under Customer Permission and remove the {{Share}} feature from the Customer Portal.
fields.summary: Allow Service Desk administrator to disable the "Share" feature

fields.description:
Currently, Confluence does not support properly support multiple language versions of pages within the same space (see CONFSERVER-57384, CONFCLOUD-1076). A common workaround is to make multiple spaces, one for each language.

Service Desk itself supports multiple language localization, however, we are forced to make multiple Confluence spaces and Service Desk can only connect to one at a time. Therefore, due to the limitation in Confluence, we have to make multiple Service Desks, one for each language.

Of course, I would prefer to properly support multiple language versions of pages within Confluence, but we gotta start somewhere...
fields.summary: Allow multiple Confluence space integrations per language

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * It's not clear in the Project settings > Customer notifications page that the "From:" email address is changed on the Project settings > Customer notifications page

h3. Suggested Solution

*  Add to the messaging on the Project settings > Customer notifications page to include something that reads like:
{noformat}
You can allow Jira to send notifications from a custom 
email address here: [Notifications|<notification_scheme_url>]
{noformat}
....or similar
h3. Why this is important
 * Allows us to provide more clarity on where customers can change the "From:" address on a customer(and also agent)notification

h3. Workaround

Messaging is currently:
{noformat}
Use this page to customize notifications that you send to customers about their requests and accounts. 
To customize the notifications that go to agents and admins, head to the [Jira notification scheme|<notification_scheme_url>]
{noformat}
fields.summary: Improve messaging surrounding  "From:" address on customer notification emails

fields.description:
Hi JSDC Team,

This is with regards to Due Dates. The best way to explain this is through a scenario.

When a SD ticket is created, assignee will then be placing a Due Date.

Now, there are possibilities wherein due dates will be adjusted. That is possible.

But management wanted to see Original Due Date as well (along side Due Date) on the Queue view.

 

We do see these on the History. But it will be awesome to see it on the queues view.

 

Thank you and more power.

 

 

Good day.
fields.summary: Original Due Date Visibility

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Statement*
Screenshot and Uploaded files via *Customer Portal* ended up being attached at the bottom of the comment section and are not movable during draft. Customer are impacted because of the following:
- There are no link generated inside the draft section for the customer to specify the location of the image/attachment to appear within text 
- Duplication will occur if the attachment is re-mentioned. 
- Explaining is difficult when refering to images that are far from the descriptions.

h3. *Suggestion*
Generate a link once file are uploaded/Screenshot pasted to the comment draft box to move the file between a specific comment. Similar to uploading files via Jira Issue view:
 [^Upload files inline comment.mov] 

Additionally, pasting multiple screenshot will be impacted by the *same name issue* which was raised as a suggestion here: [JSDCLOUD\-6433: Paste screenshot to Customer Portal use different filename|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-6433]

h3. *Workaround*
Re-mention the filename in the comment section:
{code}!imagename.png|thumbnail!{code}
fields.summary: Pasting Screenshot doesn't generate thumbnail/attachment link inline comment via Customer Portal

fields.description:
My company uses multiple Service Desks different products and languages. Each Service Desk is associated 1:1 with its own Confluence KB.

For example:
 - B2B Software (English)
 - B2B Software (Japanese)
 - B2B Software (Chinese)
 - B2C Software (English)
 - B2C Software (Japanese)
 - B2C Software (Chinese)

When a user does a search (magnifying-glass icon in upper right corner) they see the search results from all 6 KBs. This means customers will see results which might confuse them, e.g. an English-speaking B2C customer sees results for the B2B knowledge base in Chinese.

It would be better if I can control which search results they see based on their currently active Service Desk.
fields.summary: Restrict search results to Confluence KB per-Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4778].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Service Desk allows wiki mark up in request type descriptions, eg: 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
{color:Red} red text {color}
{code}

This causes the markup to appear correct when viewing the specific portal page, but when viewing all portals in the help center the wiki markup displays as text.  

Help center:

 !Image 2018-10-17 at 6.01.41 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Project portal:

 !Screen Shot 2018-10-17 at 18.02.58.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk
# Edit the request type description to include markup

h3. Expected Results
The markup is transformed in both the portal and the help center

h3. Actual Results
The markup is transformed only in the portal but not in the help center
 
h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Wiki markup not working on the Help Center

fields.description:
Summary
Date Time Picker fields on Portal X (New Help Center) will only allow times from 9am to 6pm

Steps to Reproduce
Add a date time picker field to a portal request type

Expected Results
Should be able to pick any time of the day
* !old.png|thumbnail! 

Actual Results
Can only pick times from 9am to 6pm
* !new.png|thumbnail! 

Workaround
Disable the new help center
fields.summary: Date Time Picker fields on Portal X (New Help Center) will only allow times from 9am to 6pm

fields.description:
When users email in a report or use the portal, a new portal user is created using their email address. 

A Jira agent is unable to edit the users name unless they have Site admin permissions and that would then require a license for products they do not need.

Is there a way of granting the agent permissions to edit the portal users detail/name without needing this increased level of access to admin?

Thanks
fields.summary: Unable to rename portal/email users without site admin permissions.

fields.description:
Hi!


Let's imagine that we have huge project with all kind of sub-tasks and lots design components.

Usually if you want to navigate between those sub tasks, you don't want to open them in new tab. But let's assume that all of those sub tasks contains some image or sketch in some third-party site.

You don't want to leave Jira, because you still need to read task description, or navigate to another sub task for more images, texts etc.

So my proposal is to automatically open all third-party links in new window.
By third-party i mean all links, which leads outside from Jira's domain name.


It is pretty simple adjustment, but it really will make some users happy.

Thank you for Jira, SourceTree and other products.
They are really make developer's life easier.

Stay awesome and have a nice day!
fields.summary: Open all third-party links in new tab

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there's no options to set customer permission only to let them view the request , but not able to create any ticket from Customer Portal.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create a customer permission scheme for JIRA Service Desk project to control customer access.

h3. Why this is important
Add flexibility to the project admin to control the customer permission.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround.
fields.summary: Ability to set permission for Customer to view the issue request , but not able to create any issue from Customer Portal
AP.getCurrentUser does not work in serviceDeskPortalRequestCreatePropertyPanels

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

If a user is using a Service Desk project that has a workflow that has a screen on the transition event, the screen does not come up.

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a service desk project of type IT Project.
# Create a new Screen *Approve*
# Add any field to the screen.
# Modify the Change Workflow.
#- This by default has the approve/deny transitions.
# Add the screen created to the approve and deny transitions.
# Publish the workflow and reindex JIRA.
# Create a new issue in JIRA service desk(portal or UI).
# Attempt to approve or deny the issue.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would show you the workflow screen you configured to allow you enter expected values(e.g. Comments).

h5. Actual Result

JIRA would automatically perform the transition without the screen ever showing up.
fields.summary: Screens on Approve/Deny Service Desk Transitions do not appear

fields.description:
h3. Summary
An approval step would not consider workflow validation and would allow the transition


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an approval step to transition from Approval required > Approved
# Add a validator to require a field to have a value before transitioning Approval required > Approved

h3. Expected Results
An error will be displayed asking to provide a value for the field
h3. Actual Results
The ticket is transitioned without considering the validator

h3.Workaround
No workarounds at the moment
fields.summary: Approval step bypasses workflow validator

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Sometimes it would be good to restrict certain customers from creating tickets and only allow them to view, essentially a read-only user.

Currently, you can only allow all Service Desk Customers - portal only user from the permission scheme

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a permission or group available to customers so administrators can restrict some customers from creating tickets

h3. Workaround

Not very manageable for a large amount of customers:
# Add individual customers who should be allowed to create tickets as single users to a non-applicable permission like _'Edit Own Worklogs'_ or anything they have no use for.
# Update workflow create transition validator to _Only users with *Edit Own Worklogs* permission can execute this transition._
fields.summary: Ability to restrict portal customers issue creation with permissions or groups

fields.description:
In some scenarios, it's useful for Service Desk customers to be granted a Jira license to have the ability to create filters and perform other actions only available to licensed users.

However, administrators may choose to control the available actions and permissions on issues - e.g. workflow transitions - through Service Desk, which only allows for actions to be executed when viewing issues in Customer Portal.

It should be possible to quickly navigate to the Customer Portal view of issues through a link on the Jira view, like the one shown for Service Desk agents.
fields.summary: "View in Customer Portal" link for Jira Core/SW users

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition:
We are trying to route our tickets to certain service desk users based on what time the ticket was created. We don't want any
interaction or error on the customer's side to influence how a ticket gets routed. Rather, we essentially want all tickets from around the world created between a certain time frame (let's say 8:00am-7:00pm MST for example) to be routed to one service desk user, and then all tickets that are not created during that time frame to be routed otherwise.

h3. Suggest Resolution
Create an automation trigger to verify the timezone that the ticket was sent.
fields.summary: Automation to route tickets by timezone

fields.description:
*Summary*
Required fields on the Portal display error messages in English, instead of Portuguese

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Have profile set to Portuguese
# Make a field required (either on the Field Configuration on the Request Type settigns)
# Create a ticket on the Portal for that Issue/Request Type
# Leave a required field blank

*Expected Results*
An error in portuguese saying that the field is required

*Actual Results*
An error in *English* saying that the field is required
 !nottranslated.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Required fields on the Portal display error messages in English, instead of Portuguese

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment, Ii the agent view (KB Hub), we have some frontend sorting by alphabetical. However, in Customer Portal there is no frontend sorting happen so the order is following how they are stored in the database.

!kb.gif|width=500,height=290!
h3. Suggested Solution

Consistent sorting experience in both side KB Hub and Customer Portal.
h3. Why this is important

To have more control over how the categories/KB are ordered.
fields.summary: Consistent sorting experience in both side KB Hub and Customer Portal.

fields.description:
Hello, 

As part of our bug and enhancement request intake process for issues that are raised by our customers to our support team, our development team requires very specific information to be entered when creating the request. It appears that when using the Create Linked Issue feature within a support issue, the fields displayed in the Create Linked Issue form cannot be customized.

Are there any plans on enhancing the product so that the linked issue form can be customized to contain certain fields?
fields.summary: Ability to modify fields on Create Linked Issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * When using the new help center in a non-English language, the language in the date picker is displaying in English
 * On the old help center, the name of the day/month is translated correctly
  
h3. Environment

 * Jira Service Desk
 * "new help center" enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the customer profile page by clicking on the user's avatar > Profile({{https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/user/profile}}) and change the language to a non-english language
 # Create a new request in the help center

h3. Expected Results
 * The calendar is displayed in the correct language

h3. Actual Results
 * The calendar is displayed in English
 * Not highlighted in the screenshot, but the days are also in English

||Old help center||New help center||
|!Screen Shot 2018-10-11 at 11.57.06 PM.png|thumbnail!|!Screen Shot 2018-10-11 at 11.57.50 PM.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Notes
 * This issues only happen in the "new help center"
 * In the example above, the "Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker" setting is set to "Yes". The "Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker" setting also has no effect on the date picker in the "new help center"; Jira settings > System > Look and feel({{https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/LookAndFeel!default.jspa}})

h3. Workaround

 

*This Workaround is obsolete*
 * Turn off the "new help center": Navigate to Project Settings > Portal Settings > View and customize; under "Try the new help center", put the toggle switch into the "off" position.  Please quote this bug ticket number in the feedback form.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-11 at 11.37.11 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: New help center: date picker language not aligned with Jira settings

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * When the date format is changed in Jira({{https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa}}), the date picker field in the "new help center" should conform to the settings defined in Jira
 * Currently, when the date format has been changed e.g. {{dd.MM.yyy}} instead of the default {{d/MMM/yy}} format, the dates are either displayed incorrectly(dates in the future) or a false error message is thrown(dates in the past)
 * This issue doesn't occur in the old help center
 
h3. Environment

 * Jira Service Desk
 * "new help center" enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Define the date format in Jira settings > System > General settings; Advanced Settings({{https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/AdvancedApplicationProperties.jspa}}). For demonstration purposes, we are using {{dd.MM.yyyy}}:
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-11 at 9.36.54 PM.png|thumbnail!
 # Add a date picker(type) field to the appropriate Request Type|https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-jira-service-desk/create-service-desk-request-types-917968307.html]
 # Ensure that the "new help center" is enabled. Navigate to Project Settings > Portal Settings > View and customize; under "Try the new help center. Click the toggle switch to the "on" position
 # Navigate to the help center and try to enter dates into the date picker

h3. Expected Results
 * Correct date displayed when entered using the expected date format
 * Customer is allowed to enter dates as per the format defined in the "Advanced Jira Settings"

h3. Actual Results

When setting a date in the past:
||Old help center||New help center||
|!Screen Shot 2018-10-11 at 10.19.12 PM.png|thumbnail!|!Screen Shot 2018-10-11 at 10.12.21 PM.png|thumbnail!|

When setting a date in the future:
 !year_3100_1.2018-10-11 22_02_41.gif!
h3. Notes
 * This issues only happen in the "new help center"
 * In the example above, the "Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker" setting is set to "Yes". The "Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker" setting also has no effect on the date picker in the "new help center"; Jira settings > System > Look and feel({{https://<instance_name>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/LookAndFeel!default.jspa}})

 * The date picker seems to work correctly when using the default {{d/MMM/yy}} format

h3. Workaround
 * Turn off the "new help center": Navigate to Project Settings > Portal Settings > View and customize; under "Try the new help center", put the toggle switch into the "off" position.  Please quote this bug ticket number in the feedback form.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-11 at 11.37.11 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: New help center: date picker format not aligned with Jira settings

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If Jira Service Desk project is integrated to a Confluence Knowledge and you choose to allow all active users and customers (that is, logged in users who do not have a Confluence license) to view specific spaces. The customers are getting an error when accessing the Confluence pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project 
# Link a Confluence space to the project as a Knowledge base
# Set the access to "Everyone with access to your service desk can read articles without a Confluence license. This option is best if you want to share knowledge base articles with your customers."
# Create a customer account, a customer who has an Atlassian account and don't have any Application access to any product
# Add this customer as a customer to the Service Desk Project
# Log in as the customer and try to access the pages in the linked Confluence space.

h3. Expected Results
* Unlicensed users with Atlassian Account added as customers to a project should be able to access the pages of a linked knowledge base directly from Confluence. 

h3. Actual Results
* Unlicensed users are getting when access the pages in the linked Confluence space
{code}
Error: null is not an object (evaluating 'e.user.confluence.locale').
    in t
    in t
    in SpaceNavigation
    in InjectIntl(SpaceNavigation)
    in StyledComponent(n)
    in Connect(StyledComponent(n))
    in e
    in div
    in ConfluenceNavigation
    in StyledComponent(i)
    in Connect(StyledComponent(i
{code}
fields.summary: Unlicensed customers with Atlassian Account are unable to access the Confluence knowledge base pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Some banners do not fit well on a screen with a different size.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow configuring Customer Portal banner for multiple viewpoints
fields.summary: Allow configuring Customer Portal banner for Multiple Viewpoints

fields.description:
Summary
Instances with only JSD and no Jira Software allow users without Administer Jira permission to try to create next-gen projects

Environment
Jira Service Desk instance *without* Jira Software

Steps to Reproduce
# Impersonate a user with no Administer Jira permission
# Go to the projects list
# Click "Create project"

Expected Results
There should be no create project button

Actual Results
The user will receive the following error:

{quote}
*Connection lost*
It could be because your internet dropped out or the server is having a moment. Try refreshing the page, or try again later.
{quote}

Workaround
Disable *Create next-gen projects* global permission.
fields.summary: Cloud instances without Jira Software have the Next-Gen projects global permission

fields.description:
*Summary*
A message appears saying invites were sent when bulk inviting users, when no invites were actually sent.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Disable Customer Notifications for Customer Invited
# Bulk Invite customers

*Expected Results*
No invite is sent

*Actual Results*
No invite is sent, but a message says that they were sent, confusing admins
fields.summary: A message appears saying that invites were sent when Customer Notification for invites are disable wen bulk adding customers

fields.description: As a service desk administrator, I want to be able to set a custom date-span in the dashboard gadget for Jira service desk-reports just like in the actual service desk reports.
fields.summary: Custom date-span in jira service desk report-gadget

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the Service Desk portal, when customers make a request, JIRA Service Desk will provide a suggestion based on the summary field for self serve
 !sd1.gif! 
However, this can sometimes causes the user to accidentally hit the suggestion when trying to add the description


h3. Suggested Solution
Allow admin to enable and disable the knowledge based suggestion
fields.summary: Ability to turn on/off the knowledge based suggestion

fields.description: It would be nice to have the option to drag and drop the JIRA Service Desk Widget, so the customers have the option to rearrange their widget's position on the screen.
fields.summary: Add the option to drag and drop JIRA Service Desk Widget

fields.description: We are using the default resolve screen for resolving our requests. So in this resolve screen we want to include some final quality checks, one of these is to add links to knowledgebase articles if it has nog been done previously or incorrectly. Now we have succeeded in adding some other fields to this screen but have not been able to add the knowledgebase section. Please advise.
fields.summary: Cannot add knowledgebase linking section to resolve screen
Prevent customers to add themselves as Approver

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when customer transition from Customer Portal , a screen pop up and only "Comment" field exist. There's no way to customize the screen or remove comment field from the screen.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow admin to customize transition screen for Customer Portal view.
* Include Attachment field in the screen.

h3. Why this is important
Admin required information from the customer when transitioning the ticket.

h3. Workaround 
No workaround
fields.summary: Allow to customize transition screen for Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When the $\{request.sharedwith} variable is used in a notification template, the notification will only consist of 3 names, followed by *and X other people*
!sd.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggestion
It would be best that this is configurable, for example to display all users or any number of names configured
fields.summary: Configurable number of users displayed for the "Request shared with" variable (${request.sharedwith}) in Service Desk notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While sorting the queues by status, it is not sorting from A -> Z.

h3. Environment

Queues.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Go to the project queues;
# Sort the queue on the fly by statuses;

h3. Expected results

The statuses should be sorted alphabetically;

h3. Actual result

The statuses are not sorted alphabetically as the label indicates.
 !Screen Shot 2018-10-05 at 09.51.20.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2018-10-05 at 09.51.28.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Sorting queues on the fly by status is not in alphabetical order
